abstract: In a nation where hunting and meat eating is idealized, affection between humans and animals is seen as a type of illness.
snippet: In a nation where hunting and meat eating is idealized, affection between humans and animals is seen as a type of illness.
lead_paragraph: In a 1991 interview titled "Eating Well," Jacques Derrida wonders whether a head of state (chef d'Etat) could gain office by declaring himself or herself a vegetarian.  He concludes, "The chief (chef) must be an eater of flesh."
